page.title: 16THE SHREWTON DAIRY
page.content: The dairy belongs to Mr. E. G. Withers but his son Stuart Withers milks the cows and delivers the milk. The Dairy has been going for about 60 years and now Stuart has about 50 cows. He gets up early in the morning at 6.30a.m. and then delivers the milk. Later on in the evening he washes the bottles and milks the cows. He delivers roughly 560 bottles a day and about 3,920 bottles a week. He delivers all the way through Shrewton up to Orcheston. He has a Dairy in Orcheston and he sometimes bottles the milk over there. A bottle of milk costs 23 pence.
